title: Transform product catalog into mobile e-commerce app with cart, COD checkout, and order management

requirements.summary: Implement shopping cart system with add to cart, quantity adjustments, item removal, and total price calculation
acceptanceCriteria: Users can add products to cart from the catalog
Cart displays all added items with quantities and individual prices
Users can increase/decrease quantities or remove items from cart
Cart shows running total of all items
Cart persists for authenticated users across sessions

file_operations.description: Create React Query hook to fetch cart contents using getCart() from backend, enabled only when user is authenticated
Create mutation hook for addToCart(productId, quantity) that invalidates cart query on success
Create mutation hook for updateCartQuantity(productId, quantity) that invalidates cart query on success
Create mutation hook for removeFromCart(productId) that invalidates cart query on success

Create sliding drawer component from right side displaying cart items with product image, name, price, quantity controls (+/-), remove button, and total calculation. Include empty cart state and checkout button.
Create button component that accepts productId and stock, checks authentication before adding to cart, shows loading state during mutation, and displays success feedback

Add cart icon button with item count badge in header that opens CartDrawer. Use generated cart-icon.dim_64x64.png from frontend/public/assets/generated/cart-icon.dim_64x64.png. Show cart only for authenticated users.
Add AddToCartButton to each ProductCard for authenticated users. Replace WhatsApp-only flow with e-commerce cart flow for logged-in users while keeping WhatsApp button for guests.

requirements.summary: Create COD checkout flow with shipping details form, order placement, and confirmation
acceptanceCriteria: Checkout page displays cart summary with total amount
Form collects customer name, phone number, complete delivery address, and city
Order is created with 'pending' status upon submission
Confirmation message displays order ID and estimated delivery timeframe
No payment processing is required at checkout

file_operations.description: Create mutation hook for checkout(shippingDetails) that returns order ID, invalidates cart and orders queries on success

Create checkout page displaying cart summary with items, quantities, prices, and total. Include form with fields for name, phone (tel input type), complete address (textarea), and city (text input). Submit button calls checkout mutation and navigates to confirmation page on success. Include Nepal location icon from frontend/public/assets/generated/nepal-pin.dim_48x48.png in address section.

Create order confirmation page that displays order ID from URL params, success message, estimated delivery timeframe (5-7 business days for nationwide delivery), and button to view order details or return to catalog
Add routes for /checkout and /order-confirmation/:orderId pages with proper authentication guards
Add 'Proceed to Checkout' button that navigates to /checkout route when cart has items

requirements.summary: Implement user registration and login with Internet Identity for customers, allowing order tracking and cart persistence
acceptanceCriteria: Customers can register/login using Internet Identity
Customer authentication is separate from admin privileges
Logged-in customers can view their order history
Guest users can browse but must login to checkout
Customer accounts have no access to admin features

file_operations.description: Create query hook for getCallerUserProfile() with proper loading state handling to prevent modal flash. Use the authorization component's pattern: return custom state with isLoading that accounts for actorFetching, and isFetched that checks both actor and query.isFetched.
Create mutation hook for saveCallerUserProfile(profile) that invalidates currentUserProfile query on success

Create modal component for first-time user profile setup. Display when authenticated user has no profile. Form collects name, phone, address, and city. Submit calls saveCallerUserProfile mutation. Use authorization component's pattern to prevent flash: show only when isAuthenticated && !profileLoading && isFetched && userProfile === null.
Display user name from profile instead of showing principal ID. Show LoginButton with proper authentication flow. For customers, do not show admin panel link.
Clear query cache on logout including user profile and cart data to ensure clean state
Add ProfileSetupModal to root layout so it appears after login when needed

requirements.summary: Add order tracking system where customers view order history, status, and shipping progress
acceptanceCriteria: Customers can access 'My Orders' page showing all their orders
Each order displays order ID, date, items, total amount, and current status
Order statuses include: pending, processing, shipped, delivered
Customers can click on orders to see detailed shipping information
Status updates are visible in real-time when admin changes them

file_operations.description: Create query hook for getUserOrders() that fetches current user's orders, enabled only when authenticated
Create query hook for getOrder(orderId) that fetches single order details by ID

Create customer orders page displaying order list with order ID, date (formatted from timestamp), status badge with color coding (pending: yellow, processing: blue, shipped: purple, delivered: green), total amount, and item count. Each order is clickable to navigate to order details page.

Create order details page showing order ID from URL params, order status with visual timeline/progress indicator, order items list with product names, quantities, and prices, total amount, shipping details (name, phone, address, city), and order timestamp. Include back button to My Orders.
Create reusable badge component for order status display with color coding: pending (yellow), processing (blue), shipped (purple), delivered (green)
Add routes for /my-orders and /order/:orderId pages with authentication guards
Add 'My Orders' navigation link for authenticated customers (visible when logged in and not on admin panel)

requirements.summary: Create admin order management dashboard to view all orders, customer details, update statuses, and manage shipping
acceptanceCriteria: Admin dashboard displays all orders with customer names, order dates, and statuses
Admin can filter orders by status (pending, processing, shipped, delivered)
Clicking an order shows full details: items, quantities, total, customer info, delivery address
Admin can update order status through dropdown or buttons
Admin can add/edit shipping notes or tracking information
Order list shows pending orders prominently for quick processing

file_operations.description: Create query hook for getAllOrders() that fetches all customer orders for admin view
Create query hook for getOrdersByStatus(status) that fetches filtered orders by status
Create mutation hook for updateOrderStatus(orderId, status) that invalidates orders queries on success

Create admin orders management page with filter tabs/buttons for order status (All, Pending, Processing, Shipped, Delivered). Display orders table with columns: Order ID, Customer Name (from user profile lookup), Date, Status, Total, and Actions. Highlight pending orders. Each row clickable to view order details.

Create admin order details page showing full order information: order ID, status with update dropdown/buttons (pending/processing/shipped/delivered), customer details (name, phone, address, city), ordered items with quantities and prices, total amount, and timestamp. Include status update controls using useUpdateOrderStatus hook.
Add routes for /admin/orders and /admin/order/:orderId pages wrapped with AdminGuard
Add navigation link or button to 'Manage Orders' that navigates to /admin/orders route

requirements.summary: Add inventory management with stock tracking, low stock alerts, and out-of-stock prevention
acceptanceCriteria: Each product has a stock quantity field visible in admin panel
Admin can set and update stock levels when adding/editing products
Products show 'Out of Stock' badge when quantity is zero
Customers cannot add out-of-stock items to cart
Admin dashboard highlights products with low stock (< 5 units)
Stock quantity decreases automatically when orders are placed

file_operations.description: Create query hook for getProductStock(productId) to fetch current stock level for a product
Create query hook for getLowStockProducts(threshold) with threshold set to 5 to fetch products needing restocking
Add stock quantity input field (number type, minimum 0) to product creation form. Include in createProduct mutation call.
Add stock quantity input field (number type, minimum 0) to product edit form, pre-filled with current stock value. Include in updateProduct mutation call.
Add stock column to products table showing current quantity. Highlight low stock products (< 5 units) with warning color/icon. Add optional low stock products filter or section at top of page.
Display 'Out of Stock' badge when product.stock is 0. Show stock level indicator for low stock items (< 5). Hide or disable add to cart functionality when out of stock.
Disable button when product stock is 0, display 'Out of Stock' text. Check stock availability before allowing add to cart action.

requirements.summary: Implement product search with text input for filtering by name, description, or category
acceptanceCriteria: Search bar is prominently placed on the catalog page
Search filters products by matching name, description, or category
Results update instantly as user types
Search is case-insensitive
Clear button resets search and shows all products

file_operations.description: Create search input component with text input field, search icon, and clear button (X). Use controlled input with onChange handler. Include debouncing for performance. Display search result count.

Add ProductSearch component above ProductGrid. Implement local filtering logic that searches through product name, description, and category fields (case-insensitive). Update displayed products based on search term. Show 'No products found' message when search returns empty results.

requirements.summary: Add product category system with Electronics, Clothing, Home & Kitchen, Beauty, Sports categories and filtering
acceptanceCriteria: Product data model includes category field
Admin can select category from dropdown when adding/editing products
Categories include: Electronics, Clothing, Home & Kitchen, Beauty & Personal Care, Sports & Outdoors
Catalog page shows category filter buttons or dropdown
Clicking a category filters products to show only that category
Products display their category badge on product cards

file_operations.description: Create query hook for getProductsByCategory(category) that fetches filtered products by category

Create category filter component with buttons or pills for each category: Electronics, Clothing, Home & Kitchen, Beauty & Personal Care, Sports & Outdoors. Include 'All' option to clear filter. Highlight active category.

Create category badge component that displays product category with appropriate color coding: Electronics (blue), Clothing (purple), Home & Kitchen (green), Beauty & Personal Care (pink), Sports & Outdoors (orange)
Add category dropdown/select field to product creation form with options: electronics, clothing, home, books (mapped as Beauty & Personal Care), sports. Include in createProduct mutation call.
Add category dropdown/select field to product edit form, pre-selected with current category. Include in updateProduct mutation call.

Add CategoryFilter component above product grid (below search). Implement category filtering by calling useProductsByCategory when category is selected, or useProducts for all categories. Combine with search filtering if search term is present.
Add CategoryBadge component to display product category on each product card

requirements.summary: Implement Nepali language toggle with translation for all UI text while keeping product content unchanged
acceptanceCriteria: Language toggle button visible in header (English/नेपाली)
All UI text, labels, buttons, and messages translate to Nepali when selected
Product names and descriptions remain as entered by admin (not translated)
Language preference persists across page navigation
Nepali text uses proper Unicode fonts and displays correctly
Currency displays as रू (Nepali Rupees) in Nepali mode

file_operations.description: Create language context provider with state for current language (en/ne), toggle function, and translation dictionary for all UI strings. Persist language preference in localStorage. Provide useLanguage hook.

Create translation dictionary with English and Nepali translations for all UI text: navigation labels, buttons, form labels, messages, status labels (pending/processing/shipped/delivered), category names, error messages, etc. Use proper Nepali Unicode text.
Create language toggle button component that switches between English and नेपाली. Display current language. Call language toggle function from context.
Add LanguageToggle component to header navigation. Use translation context for header text (if any UI labels exist).
Wrap app with LanguageProvider to make language context available throughout the app
Use translation context for all UI text: search placeholder, filter labels, empty state messages, loading text. Keep product names and descriptions untranslated.
Use translation context for all form labels (Name, Phone, Address, City), button text, validation messages. Format currency with रू symbol in Nepali mode.
Use translation context for page title, column headers, status labels, empty state message. Format currency appropriately.
Use translation context for all labels and status text. Format currency and dates appropriately for selected language.
Use translation context for cart title, quantity labels, total label, checkout button text, empty cart message. Format currency with रू in Nepali mode.
Use translation context to display status text in selected language: pending (पेन्डिङ), processing (प्रक्रियामा), shipped (पठाइएको), delivered (डेलिभर भयो)
Use translation context to display category names in selected language

requirements.summary: Add smooth animations: fade-in page loads, sliding cart drawer, scale-in confirmations, hover effects
acceptanceCriteria: All page loads use fade-in animation (300ms duration)
Shopping cart opens as sliding drawer from right side
Success messages (order placed, item added) appear with scale-in animation
Product cards have subtle hover lift effect
Loading states use smooth skeleton animations
All animations are smooth (60fps) and don't cause layout shifts

file_operations.description: Create page transition wrapper component using CSS transitions or Framer Motion for fade-in effect (300ms duration, ease-out). Apply to all page loads.

Add sliding animation from right side when drawer opens/closes. Use CSS transitions with transform: translateX or Framer Motion. Include backdrop with fade-in animation. Ensure 60fps performance with transform and opacity only.

Create toast notification component for success/error messages with scale-in animation (transform: scale(0.9) to scale(1), 200ms duration). Auto-dismiss after 3 seconds. Position fixed at top or bottom.
Add hover lift effect using CSS transition on transform: translateY(-4px) and box-shadow increase. Use transition duration 200ms ease-out. Ensure no layout shift.
Create skeleton loading component with shimmer animation for product cards and lists. Use gradient animation with background-position. Apply to loading states across app.
Wrap route components with PageTransition for consistent fade-in effect on navigation
Use LoadingSkeleton component instead of plain loading text when products are loading
Trigger Toast notification on successful add to cart with 'Item added to cart' message
Trigger Toast notification on successful checkout before navigation

requirements.summary: Optimize for mobile-responsive design with touch-friendly controls across all screen sizes (320px to tablets)
acceptanceCriteria: All pages are fully responsive on mobile devices (320px - 768px)
Touch targets are minimum 44x44px for easy tapping
Product grid adjusts from 1 column on mobile to 4 columns on desktop
Forms use appropriate mobile input types (tel for phone, text for names)
Navigation is mobile-friendly with hamburger menu if needed
Cart drawer slides smoothly on mobile touch gestures
No horizontal scrolling on any screen size

file_operations.description: Update grid to use responsive Tailwind classes: grid-cols-1 (mobile), sm:grid-cols-2 (tablet), md:grid-cols-3, lg:grid-cols-4. Ensure proper gap spacing for touch interaction.

Create mobile navigation component with hamburger menu for small screens. Include navigation links, language toggle, cart icon, and user profile/login. Use slide-in animation from left. Show/hide based on screen size breakpoint.

Make header responsive: show MobileNav (hamburger menu) on small screens, full horizontal navigation on desktop. Ensure cart icon and login button are minimum 44x44px touch targets. Test on 320px width.
Ensure all interactive elements (buttons, links) are minimum 44x44px touch targets. Make card layout stack vertically on mobile with adequate spacing. Test image responsiveness.

Use mobile-appropriate input types: type='tel' for phone input, type='text' for name and address. Ensure form fields are adequately sized for touch input (min-height 44px). Use single-column layout on mobile, two-column on tablet+. Add proper spacing between fields.

Optimize drawer width for mobile (full width on small screens, max-width on desktop). Ensure quantity controls are touch-friendly (44x44px minimum). Test swipe-to-close gesture on mobile. Add proper padding for thumb zones.
Use card-based layout on mobile instead of table. Stack order information vertically. Ensure touch targets for order items are adequate. Test on 320px width.

Add responsive font sizes using clamp() or Tailwind responsive classes. Ensure base font size is readable on mobile (minimum 16px for inputs to prevent zoom). Add mobile-first media queries. Prevent horizontal scroll with max-width and overflow-x-hidden on body.
Configure mobile-first breakpoints if needed. Add custom spacing for touch-friendly layouts. Ensure all interactive utilities support minimum 44x44px touch targets.

requirements.summary: Replace warm earthy colors with modern mobile e-commerce design using blue or green accents, white backgrounds, high contrast
acceptanceCriteria: Primary color scheme uses trustworthy blue or energetic green tones
Background is clean white or very light gray for product visibility
Accent colors highlight calls-to-action (Add to Cart, Checkout buttons)
Text contrast meets WCAG AA standards on all backgrounds
Color scheme conveys trust and professionalism for online shopping
Design feels modern and aligned with popular e-commerce apps

file_operations.description: Replace existing warm earthy OKLCH color variables with modern e-commerce palette: primary blue (--primary: oklch(0.55 0.22 250)) or green (oklch(0.60 0.18 150)), white background (--background: oklch(1 0 0)), light gray secondary background (oklch(0.98 0 0)), high contrast text colors for WCAG AA compliance. Update --accent for CTAs with vibrant blue/green matching primary.

Update color theme to match new palette: primary (blue or green), background (white), secondary (light gray), accent for CTAs. Ensure colors map correctly to CSS variables. Configure high-contrast text colors. Update button, badge, and card styling to use new professional e-commerce colors.
Update styling to use new color scheme: white card background, subtle shadow, blue/green accent on hover, high contrast text. Ensure professional e-commerce appearance.
Update header styling with new color scheme: white or very light gray background, primary color for branding/logo text, accent color for cart badge, high contrast navigation text
Style button with accent color background (vibrant blue or green), white text, proper hover state with darker shade, ensure WCAG AA contrast ratio
Apply new color scheme: white background, primary color for headings, accent color for checkout button, high contrast form labels and inputs
